newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish pay pressures may weigh on EBR goal - C.Bank.
newsitem.headline: Irish pay pressures may weigh on EBR goal - C.Bank.

text.p: Ireland's Central Bank said on Tuesday that there is a danger that emerging pressure on public sector pay could reduce the likelihood of an undershoot in the 1997 EBR target.
The government set a target Exchequer Borrowing Requirement of 637 million Irish pounds for the full-year 1997.
The Central Bank said in its 1996 annual report that exchequer returns for end-March showed an EBR of 151 million in the first quarter of 1997.
This was less than 24 percent of the 1997 budget target and reflected favourable timing factors, early receipts of EU transfers and strong revenue growth.

But the bank said "while the underlying position of the public finances is strong, there is a danger that emerging pressure on the public sector pay could reduce the likelihood of an undershoot in the 1997 EBR target".
